column4: Evening all. How do I connect Ubuntu 12.04 to the existing Windows 7 workgroup on my home network?
you mean see the windows 'shares' ? or how by 'connect'
I want to be able to access my wife's shared folders and the shared printer we have connected to her PC running Windows 7.

in the file manager, there is a connect to server.. feature  to see the windows network. or you can enter the url to the share directly. (ctrl -l to show address entry field) and enter  smb://server.name.or.ipnumber/sharename
anytime you are looking at your files./homedir/otherstuff.. you are most likely using the nautilus file manager
: What do I put in the port, type, and folder fields?
select samba as the type of server to connect to,.
i alswya just enter the smb://servername/sharename  directly in the address bar
: is there an easy way to share a screenshot with you?
in the file manager.. hit ctrl-l and type in the address smb://YourServersname/sharename   and see if it works
Error: Failed to mount Windows Share
now try the windows machines ip number,. instead of server name
on the windows box.  theres differnt ways. i open a terminal and use ipconfig   normally
or try 'findsmb' or 'smbtree'' on linux to scan the network and look
: when I plug that in, I still get an error
